bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 19, 1915

div1.p: Blue assigns LePrince and Carter to investigate malarial conditions in South Carolina.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 19, 1915
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
CD
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 19, 1915.
Senior Surgeon H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir;
div1.p:
The Bureau is in receipt of a letter of the 15th in-
stant from Dr. James A. Hayne, Secretary and State Health
Officer, Columbia, S. C., in which request is made that Sani-
tary Engineer J. A. A. Le Prine and you be detailed to assist
the State Board in remedying malaria conditions caused by the
impounding of waters by the Parr Shoals Hydro-electric Company.
It is the intention of the Bureau to have Mr. Le Prince and
you confer with and advise the State Board and the above men-
tioned company in respect to the problems presented. You are
requested to state, therefore, the earliest time that would
be most suitable to go to South Carolina for this purpose, it
being desirable to complete this detail before the regular
antimalaria work of the season shall have begun.
